The code's missing part is the condition inside the loop that checks whether the current pair can form the required structure. 

The correct condition is that for each pair of elements (x, y), the minimal of the pair must be the first element. If not, it returns -1. 

The code should look like this:

import java.util.*;

public class code {
    static Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        int t = sc.nextInt();
        while (t-- > 0) {
            int m = sc.nextInt();
            ArrayList<Integer> a = new ArrayList<>();
            for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
                a.add(sc.nextInt());
            }

            int ans = 0;
            for (int i = 1; i < m; i <<= 1) {
                ArrayList<Integer> temp = new ArrayList<>();
                for (int j = 0; j < a.size(); j += 2) {
                    int x = a.get(j);
                    int y = a.get(j + 1);
                    if (x > y) {
                        ans++;
                    }
                    temp.add(Math.min(x, y));
                }
                a = temp;
            }
            System.out.println(ans);
        }
    }
}

The correct condition is that for each pair of elements (x, y), the minimal of the pair must be the first element. If not, it returns -1. 

The code should look like this:

import java.util.*;

public class code {
    static Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        int t = sc.nextInt();
        while (t-- > 0) {
            solve();
        }
    }

    static void solve() {
        int m = sc.nextInt();
        ArrayList<Integer> a = new ArrayList<>();
        for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
            a.add(sc.nextInt());
        }

        int ans = 0;
        for (int i = 1; i < m; i <<= 1) {
            ArrayList<Integer> temp = new ArrayList<>();
            for (int j = 0; j < a.size(); j += 2) {
                int x = a.get(j);
                int y = a.get(j + 1);
                if (x > y) {
                    ans++;
                }
                temp.add(Math.min(x, y));
            }
            a = temp;
        }
        System.out.println(ans);
    }
}
